segments.text: I notice the boy stretching toward the cookie jar, balancing on that unsteady stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just waiting, like this is some kind of game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the sink, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on drying that plate, like the world around her doesn’t exist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children do this often when she’s distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to collapse, and the boy doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is so calm, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is already on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s hand is outstretched, waiting for her cookie like it’s the most natural thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is going to end badly if someone doesn’t step in soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
